text: [BS] Kognitivna disonanca je psihološki fenomen koji se javlja kada pojedinac osjeća nelagodu zbog sukoba u vjerovanjima, stavovima ili ponašanju.
question: Šta je kognitivna disonanca?

text: [EN] Cognitive dissonance is a psychological phenomenon that occurs when an individual experiences discomfort due to conflicting beliefs, attitudes, or behaviors.
question: What is cognitive dissonance?

text: [BS] Leon Festinger je 1957. godine prvi uveo teoriju kognitivne disonance.
question: Ko je uveo teoriju kognitivne disonance?

text: [EN] Leon Festinger first introduced the theory of cognitive dissonance in 1957.
question: Who introduced the theory of cognitive dissonance?

text: [BS] Kognitivna disonanca se javlja kada osoba istovremeno ima dva ili više suprotstavljena vjerovanja, vrijednosti ili ideje.
question: Kada se javlja kognitivna disonanca?

text: [EN] Cognitive dissonance occurs when a person holds two or more contradictory beliefs, values, or ideas simultaneously.
question: When does cognitive dissonance occur?

text: [BS] Promjena stava je proces u kojem se vjerovanja ili mišljenja osobe mijenjaju tokom vremena.
question: Šta je promjena stava?

text: [EN] Attitude change is the process by which a person's beliefs or opinions about a subject alter over time.

text: [BS] Justifikacija je čin racionalizacije ili davanja razloga za vlastito ponašanje ili vjerovanja, posebno kada su u sukobu.

text: [BS] Potvrđujuća pristrasnost je tendencija traženja informacija koje potvrđuju postojeća vjerovanja, dok se minimiziraju ili zanemaruju informacije koje ih opovrgavaju.
question: Šta je potvrđujuća pristrasnost?

text: [EN] Confirmation bias is the tendency to seek out and favor information that confirms existing beliefs while disregarding or minimizing information that contradicts those beliefs.
question: What is confirmation bias?

text: [EN] Behavior modification refers to the techniques used to change undesirable behaviors through reinforcement and punishment.

text: [BS] Marketinški stručnjaci koriste kognitivnu disonancu kako bi ohrabrili potrošače da opravdaju svoje odluke o kupovini.

text: [EN] Marketers use cognitive dissonance to encourage consumers to justify their purchasing decisions.

text: [EN] In education, cognitive dissonance is used to encourage students to think critically.
